text: Piper darienense is a flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is called Duermeboca in Panama. In El Chocó, the plant is used as a fish poison. Cuna, an indigenous people of Panama and Colombia, call it Kana, and they use it in a bath, for snakebites and colds. ==References== Category:Flora of Bolivia Category:Flora of Peru Category:Flora of Panama Category:Flora of Colombia Category:Flora of Nicaragua Category:Flora of Costa Rica
title: Piper darienense
